category: A VISIT TO A JAPANESE TEMPLE

clues.question: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Kiyomizudera Temple in Kyoto, Japan.)  Japanese Buddhism is divided into several sects; Kiyomizudera Temple represents North Hosso Buddhism, brought from this country in the 600s
Kiyomizudera is said to have been built in honor of a bodhisattva, one who forgoes advancing to this enlightened state

Behind Sai-mon, the West Gate, rises Sanju-no-to, the tallest of these structures in all of Japan
